Research Papers on Copyright Compliance and Memorization in Large Language Models
Uri Hacohen and colleagues investigate data-driven biases in GenAI copyright disputes
Haodong Li and researchers develop Digger for detecting copyright content mis-usage in language model training
Boyi Wei and team evaluate copyright takedown methods for language models
Felix B Mueller and researchers examine LLMs and memorization with focus on copyright compliance
Tong Chen and colleagues create CopyBench to measure literal and non-literal reproduction of copyright-protected text
Researchers are exploring various techniques to address copyright concerns in large language models
Multiple studies focus on unlearning, memorization mitigation, and copyright detection in AI systems
Research aims to develop methods for preventing verbatim memorization and protecting intellectual property
Papers propose technical approaches to assess and mitigate copyright risks in generative AI technologies
